org.opentcs.access

Interface Kernel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventSource<TCSEvent>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    KernelProxy, LocalKernel

    public interface Kernel
extends EventSource<TCSEvent>
    Declares the methods the openTCS kernel must implement which are accessible both to internal components and remote peers (like graphical user interfaces).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Kernel.State
      The various states a kernel instance may be running in.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_MODEL_NAME
      The default name used for the empty model created on startup.

      default void withdrawTransportOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref, boolean disableVehicle)
      Deprecated. 
      Call withdrawTransportOrder(org.opentcs.data.TCSObjectReference, boolean, boolean) instead. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0.
      void withdrawTransportOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref, boolean immediateAbort, boolean disableVehicle)
      Withdraw the referenced order, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle that might be processing it.
      default void withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef, boolean disableVehicle)
      Deprecated. 
      Call withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(org.opentcs.data.TCSObjectReference, boolean, boolean) instead. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0.
      void withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef, boolean immediateAbort, boolean disableVehicle)
      Withdraw any order that a vehicle might be processing, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle.

        userName - The new user's name.
        userPassword - The new user's password.
        userPermissions - The new user's permissions.
        Throws:

      • loadModel

        void loadModel()
        throws java.io.IOException,
               CredentialsException
        Loads the saved model into the kernel. If there is no saved model, a new empty model will be loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the model cannot be loaded.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • saveModel

        void saveModel(@Nullable
               java.lang.String modelName)
        throws java.io.IOException,
               CredentialsException
        Saves the current model under the given name. If there is a saved model, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name under which the current model is to be saved. If null, the model's current name will be used, otherwise the model will be renamed accordingly.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the model could not be persisted for some reason.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • removeModel

        void removeModel()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 CredentialsException
        Removes the saved model if there is one.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If deleting the model was not possible for some reason.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getTCSObjects

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> java.util.Set<T> getTCSObjects(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                                 throws CredentialsException
        Returns all existing TCSObjects of the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObjects' actual type.

        clazz - The class of the objects to be returned.
        Returns:
        Copies of all existing objects of the given class.

      • getTCSObjects

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> java.util.Set<T> getTCSObjects(@Nullable
                                                        java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                        java.util.regex.Pattern regexp)
                                                 throws CredentialsException
        Returns all existing TCSObjects of the given class whose names match the given pattern.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObjects' actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the objects to be returned.
        regexp - A regular expression describing the names of the objects to be returned; if null, all objects of the given class are returned.
        Returns:
        Copies of all existing objects of the given class whose names match the given pattern. If no such objects exist, the returned set will be empty.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • renameTCSObject

        void renameTCSObject(TCSObjectReference<?> ref,
                     java.lang.String newName)
              throws CredentialsException,
                     ObjectUnknownException,
                     ObjectExistsException
        Rename a TCSObject.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the object to be renamed.
        newName - The object's new name.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced object does not exist.
        ObjectExistsException - If the object cannot be renamed because there is already an object with the given new name.

      • createVisualLayout

        VisualLayout createVisualLayout()
                         throws CredentialsException
        Adds a visual layout to the current model. A new layout is created with a unique ID and name and all other attributes set to default values. A copy of the newly created layout is then returned.
        Returns:
        A copy of the newly created layout.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

        void setPointVehicleOrientationAngle(TCSObjectReference<Point> ref,
                                     double angle)
                              throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                     CredentialsException
        Sets the vehicle's (assumed) orientation angle at the given position. The allowed value range is [-360.0..360.0], and Double.NaN, to indicate that the vehicle's orientation at the point is unspecified.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the point to be modified.
        angle - The new angle.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced point does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • createPath

        Path createPath(TCSObjectReference<Point> srcRef,
                TCSObjectReference<Point> destRef)
         throws ObjectUnknownException,
                CredentialsException
        Adds a path to the current model. A new path is created with a generated unique ID and name and ending in the point specified by the given name; all other attributes set to default values. Furthermore, the point is registered with the point which it originates in and with the one it ends in. A copy of the newly created path is then returned.
        Parameters:
        srcRef - A reference to the point which the newly created path originates in.
        destRef - A reference to the point which the newly created path ends in.
        Returns:
        A copy of the newly created path.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If any of the referenced points does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • withdrawTransportOrder

        void withdrawTransportOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref,
                            boolean immediateAbort,
                            boolean disableVehicle)
                     throws ObjectUnknownException,
                            CredentialsException
        Withdraw the referenced order, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle that might be processing it.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the transport order to be withdrawn.
        immediateAbort - If false, this method once will initiate the withdrawal, leaving the transport order assigned to the vehicle until it has finished the movements that it has already been ordered to execute. The transport order's state will change to WITHDRAWN. If true, the dispatcher will withdraw the order from the vehicle without further waiting.
        disableVehicle - Whether setting the processing state of the vehicle currently processing the transport order to Vehicle.ProcState.UNAVAILABLE to prevent immediate redispatching of the vehicle.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • withdrawTransportOrder

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="4.0.0")
default void withdrawTransportOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref,
                                                                                   boolean disableVehicle)
                                                                            throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                                                                   CredentialsException
        Deprecated. Call withdrawTransportOrder(org.opentcs.data.TCSObjectReference, boolean, boolean) instead. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0.
        Withdraw the referenced order, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle that might be processing it.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the transport order to be withdrawn.
        disableVehicle - Whether setting the processing state of the vehicle currently processing the transport order to Vehicle.ProcState.UNAVAILABLE to prevent immediate redispatching of the vehicle.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle

        void withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef,
                                     boolean immediateAbort,
                                     boolean disableVehicle)
                              throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                     CredentialsException
        Withdraw any order that a vehicle might be processing, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle.
        Parameters:
        vehicleRef - A reference to the vehicle to be modified.
        immediateAbort - If false, this method once will initiate the withdrawal, leaving the transport order assigned to the vehicle until it has finished the movements that it has already been ordered to execute. The transport order's state will change to WITHDRAWN. If true, the dispatcher will withdraw the order from the vehicle without further waiting.
        disableVehicle - Whether setting the processing state of the vehicle currently processing the transport order to Vehicle.ProcState.UNAVAILABLE to prevent immediate redispatching of the vehicle.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced vehicle does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="4.0.0")
default void withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef,
                                                                                            boolean disableVehicle)
                                                                                     throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                                                                            CredentialsException
        Deprecated. Call withdrawTransportOrderByVehicle(org.opentcs.data.TCSObjectReference, boolean, boolean) instead. Scheduled for removal with release 4.0.0.
        Withdraw any order that a vehicle might be processing, set its state to FAILED and stop the vehicle. Calling this method once will initiate the withdrawal, leaving the transport order assigned to the vehicle until it has finished the movements that it has already been ordered to execute. The transport order's state will change to WITHDRAWN. Calling this method a second time for the same vehicle/order will withdraw the order from the vehicle without further waiting.
        Parameters:
        vehicleRef - A reference to the vehicle to be modified.
        disableVehicle - Whether setting the processing state of the vehicle currently processing the transport order to Vehicle.ProcState.UNAVAILABLE to prevent immediate redispatching of the vehicle.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced vehicle does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • dispatchVehicle

        void dispatchVehicle(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef,
                     boolean setIdleIfUnavailable)
              throws ObjectUnknownException,
                     CredentialsException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Explicitly trigger dispatching of the referenced idle vehicle.
        Parameters:
        vehicleRef - A reference to the vehicle to be dispatched.
        setIdleIfUnavailable - Whether to set the vehicle's processing state to IDLE before dispatching if it is currently UNAVAILABLE. If the vehicle's processing state is UNAVAILABLE and this flag is not set, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced vehicle does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the referenced vehicle is not in a dispatchable state (IDLE or, if the corresponding flag is set, UNAVAILABLE).

      • sendCommAdapterMessage

        void sendCommAdapterMessage(TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vehicleRef,
                            java.lang.Object message)
                     throws ObjectUnknownException,
                            CredentialsException
        Sends a message to the communication adapter associated with the referenced vehicle. This method provides a generic one-way communication channel to the communication adapter of a vehicle. Note that there is no return value and no guarantee that the communication adapter will understand the message; clients cannot even know which communication adapter is attached to a vehicle, so it's entirely possible that the communication adapter receiving the message does not understand it.
        Parameters:
        vehicleRef - The vehicle whose communication adapter shall receive the message.
        message - The message to be delivered.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced vehicle does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • createTransportOrdersFromScript

        java.util.List<TransportOrder> createTransportOrdersFromScript(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                        throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                                               CredentialsException,
                                                               java.io.IOException
        Creates and returns a list of transport orders defined in a script file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the script file defining the transport orders to be created.
        Returns:
        The list of transport orders created. If none were created, the returned list is empty.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If any object referenced in the script file does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
        java.io.IOException - If there was a problem reading or parsing the file with the given name.

      • getTravelCosts

        java.util.List<TravelCosts> getTravelCosts(@Nullable
                                           TCSObjectReference<Vehicle> vRef,
                                           TCSObjectReference<Location> srcRef,
                                           java.util.Set<TCSObjectReference<Location>> destRefs)
                                    throws CredentialsException,
                                           ObjectUnknownException
        Returns the costs for travelling from one location to a given set of others.
        Parameters:
        vRef - A reference to the vehicle that shall be used for calculating the costs. If it's null a random vehicle will be used.
        srcRef - A reference to the source Location
        destRefs - A set containing all destination locations
        Returns:
        A list containing tuples of a location and the costs to travel there
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
        ObjectUnknownException - If something is not known.

      • query

        <T extends Query<T>> T query(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                      throws CredentialsException
        Returns the result of the query defined by the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The result's actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Defines the query and the class of the result to be returned.
        Returns:
        The result of the query defined by the given class, or null, if the defined query is not supported in the kernel's current state.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
